title: Executive Order 9504-Revoking the Designation of Dunkirk, New York, as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by section 1 of the act of August 1, 1914, 38 Stat. 609, 623 (19 U.S.C. 2), it is ordered that the designation of Dunkirk, New York, as a customs port of entry in Customs Collection District Number 9 (Buffalo), be, and it is hereby, revoked, effective at the close of business December 31, 1944.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 9504-Revoking the Designation of Dunkirk, New York, as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/355134
